entries: Detta avsnitt är en vidareutveckling av den mephitvarelse som finns i andra publikationer. För mer information om dessa djävulska små elementarvarelser, se dessa andra källor. I det här avsnittet ingår statistik för några mer kraftfulla mephits.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: När mephiten dör exploderar den i ett moln av ånga. Varje varelse inom en radie av 1,5 meter måste göra ett {@dc 11} räddningskast med Dexterity, och tar 9 ({@damage 2d8}) brandskador vid ett misslyckat räddningskast.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) genomträngande skada plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) brandskador.

action.name: Steam Discharge {@recharge 6}
entries: Mephit får ånga att bryta ut ur sin kropp. Varje varelse inom en 15 fot kub som utgår från mephit måste göra ett {@dc 11} räddningskast för Dexterity, och tar 9 ({@damage 2d8}) brandskador vid ett misslyckat räddningskast, eller hälften så mycket skada vid ett lyckat.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: Mephit kan kasta {@spell mirror image} utan att behöva några materiella komponenter. Dess medfödda trollkonstförmåga är Charisma.

entries: Mephits som är genomsyrade är elementarvarelser som magiskt har anpassats till sin speciella sammansättning och är starkare än en typisk mephit. Detta kan ske genom långvarig exponering, med hjälp av mer kraftfulla varelser från elementarplanerna som använder mephits som slavar, eller helt enkelt genom att mephitsen lever ett tillräckligt långt liv.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: När Mephit dör exploderar den i en explosion av lava. Varje varelse inom en halv meter från den måste göra ett {@dc 13} Dexterity räddningskast, och tar 22 ({@damage 4d10}) brandskador på ett misslyckat räddningskast, eller hälften så mycket skada på ett lyckat.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: Medan mefiten förblir orörlig är den omöjlig att skilja från en vanlig hög av magma.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mephit gör två attacker med sina klor eller med sin båge.

action.name: Magma Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) genomträngande skada plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) brandskada.

action.name: Magma Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, räckvidd 80/320 fot, ett mål. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) genomträngande skada plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) brandskada.

action.name: Molten Caltrops
entries: Mephit sprider ut smälta kaltroppar i en 15-fots fyrkant runt sig själv. Detta område anses vara svår terräng och varelser tar 7 ({@damage 2d6}) brandskador för varje 5 fot de rör sig genom denna terräng.

action.name: Lava Choke {@recharge 6}
entries: Mephit får en boll av lava att dyka upp i halsen på en varelse som den kan se inom 90 fot. Varelsen måste göra ett {@dc 13} räddningskast för konstitutionen, och får 27 ({@damage 5d10}) brandskador om räddningen misslyckas och varelsen tystas när halsen förkolnas, eller hälften så mycket skada och tystas inte om räddningen lyckas. Tystnaden varar tills varelsen tar en kort vila eller blir helad av {@spell lesser restoration} eller liknande magi.

Magma Mephit-kungen är mycket mäktigare än den traditionella Mephit-kungen. Även om dussintals mefiter vid varje given tidpunkt kommer att hävda att de är kungar, är det bara en mycket liten del av dessa som faktiskt har mer makt än en traditionell mefit. En magma mephit kan bara nå sådan makt genom att äta av resterna av en röd drake. Deras essens fyller mephiten med kraft som de kan använda för att bli mer än bara ett skadedjur, den kan utöva en kraft som konkurrerar med till och med större varelser från elementarplanerna.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Merfolket kan andas luft och vatten.

trait.name: Aquatic Travel
entries: Merfolket använder vattenstötar för att driva sin kropp framåt på land, vilket gör att det kan röra sig snabbt trots att det inte kan röra sig på marken.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sjöfolket gör två attacker med sin stav.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slående skada plus 14 ({@damage 3d8}) köldskador.

action.name: Torrent of Water
entries: Målsvarelser inom 60 fot måste lyckas med ett {@dc 16} räddningskast på Dexterity eller ta 33 ({@damage 6d10}) köldskador när en kraftfull ström av iskallt vatten rinner över dem. Om en varelse misslyckas med detta räddningskast med 10 eller mer reduceras dess rörelsehastighet till 10 fot på nästa tur.

action.name: Tether of the Tides {@recharge 5}
entries: Merfolket binder ihop två måltavlor med en ström av iskallt vatten. Om något av målen försöker röra sig mer än 20 fot bort från sin bundna partner, måste det använda 2 fot av rörelse för varje fot som det rör sig och det tar 11 ({@damage 2d10}) kallskador för varje 5 fot som det rör sig.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Merfolket är en trollkarl på 12:e nivå. Dess trollkonstförmåga är intelligens (trollformelräddning {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} för att träffa med trollformelattacker). Den har förberett följande trollkarlsbesvärjelser:

entries: Hydromancern är mycket kraftfullare än ett traditionellt sjöfolk, med förmågan att framkalla en ständigt flödande våg av vatten för att driva sig själv framåt när hon behöver resa på land. Efter årtionden av studier och övning har hon också behärskat konsten att trolla och kan böja vatten till sin vilja på nästan alla tänkbara sätt. Dessa sjöfolk är dödliga på land och en mardröm när de möts på havet.

entries.name: Scholars of the Deep
entries: Dessa sjöfolk lär sig många av sina förmågor genom att studera de varelser som ligger på botten av havets djupaste diken. Hon observerar dem nästan obsessivt, omvandlar deras unika anpassningar till magi och ibland till och med förvandlar hon sitt fysiska utseende för att matcha dessa monstruösa varelser. Det enorma trycket i djupen gör också att hennes hud blir otroligt hård och motståndskraftig mot alla attacker.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Spindeln kan klättra på svåra ytor, inklusive upp och ner på tak, utan att behöva göra en förmågaskontroll.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: Spindeln ignorerar rörelsebegränsningar som orsakas av nät.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) genomträngande skada, och målet måste göra ett {@dc 11} räddningskast med konstitutionen, och får 10 ({@damage 3d6} brandskador om räddningen misslyckas, eller hälften så mycket skada om räddningen lyckas.

action.name: Molten Web {@recharge 6}
entries: spindeln producerar en massa smält, klibbigt nät på en punkt inom sex meter. Nätet fyller en kub på 10 fot från den punkten under nästa minut. Nätet är svår terräng och skymmer lätt området. Varje varelse som börjar sin tur i näten eller som går in i dem under sin tur tar 5 ({@damage 2d4}) brandskador och måste göra ett {@dc 11} Dexterity räddningskast. Vid ett misslyckat räddningskast är varelsen {@condition restrained} så länge den är kvar i näten eller tills den bryter sig loss. En varelse som hålls tillbaka av nätverken kan använda sin handling för att göra en {@dc 11} styrkasprov och frigöra sig vid en framgång. Nätet är sårbart för vatten. Varje kub på 5 fot av nät som utsätts för vatten löses upp på 1 runda.

Dessa stora spindlar föds i eldens elementarplan och spinner nät av smält silke. Dessa nät både fångar offret och kokar det levande, vilket skapar en utsökt måltid för spindeln med minimal ansträngning. De kommer att bekläda väggarna i djupa grottor med sina nät, för även om näten är smält heta producerar de inget extra ljus - en detalj som spindeln använder till sin fördel. Spindelns bett får offrets blod att bokstavligen koka, vilket ger en olidlig smärta som genljuder i varje del av kroppen. Även om deras nät aldrig överlappar varandra brukar dessa spindlar leva i små grupper för att hjälpa varandra om fara skulle hota deras hem.

trait.name: Sand Glide
entries: Munken har en flyghastighet på 20 fot när sanden virvlar runt för att bära den. Den här fördelen fungerar endast i korta utbrott; munken faller i slutet av sin tur om den är i luften och inget annat håller den uppe.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: När munken inte bär någon rustning och inte har någon sköld, inkluderar dess AC sin visdomsmodifierare.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Munken gör tre attacker med sin quarterstaff. Den kan också använda Manipulate Sands en gång, antingen före eller efter en av attackerna.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) blåslagningsskada.

action.name: Manipulate Sands
entries: Munken skickar en ström av sand mot ett mål inom 30 fot. Målet måste göra ett {@dc 13} räddningskast för att rädda sin skicklighet och får 15 ({@damage 6d4}) slagskador och är {@condition blinded} tills slutet av sin nästa vändning om det misslyckas, eller hälften så mycket skada och är inte {@condition blinded} om det lyckas.

reaction.name: Dancing Winds (2/Day)
entries: När munken är måltavla för en spökattack på avstånd utan andra mål kan den snabbt sparka upp en vindspiral som ändrar dess bana bort från munken. Munken tar ingen skada av denna attack. Som en del av samma reaktion gör munken en distanserad trollformelattack mot en annan varelse inom 60 fot med en {@hit 5} bonus på attackkastet. Vid en träff träffar trollformeln det nya målet i stället.

Born and raised in a expansive desert or along the shores of the ocean, these monks have learned to control sand and use it as a weapon is combat. As with all monks, their hands, feet, and elbows are weapons in their own right, able to deal as much damage as a weapon forged from steel. They carry multiple pouches filled with sand that they use for both offensive and defensive maneuvers - blinding their opponents and even redirecting spells at other targets.

entries.name: Tradition Above Victory
entries: A monk holds their system of values above all else. A monk of the scattered sands is forbidden from using weapons or armor crafted of metal, similar to the restrictions most druids follow. They need to be able to defend themselves using only their influence over sand and their natural agility. This often is not a problem for monks, as their lives are free of temptation when living in their massive temples; but when they travel out into the world it can be a struggle knowing that a fight (and potentially their own life) may be lost merely because they refuse to pick up a blade.

entries.name: A Chosen Path
entries: Once these monks reach a certain age, they can choose between a few different paths for their future. These choices include staying at the temple permanently and teaching others the way of the scattered sands, taking up residence in a nearby town to act as a protector and to spread the word of their order, or to travel the world in search of holy relics to bring back to their temple to protect and worship. These monks often stand out in a room as they continue to wear traditional vibrant desert garb despite weather or culture. They will never raise their voice unless engaged in a battle and will maintain a calm demeanor up until the very moment combat begins.

trait.name: Dancing Stars
entries: Brilliant lights dance around the starcaller, exuding bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

trait.name: Retaliating Energies
entries: Whenever an enemy within 200 ft. hits the starcaller with a ranged attack, one of the stars dancing around it launches at the attacker, dealing 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Radiant Armor
entries: While the starcaller is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC incluces its Intelligence modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The starcaller makes three attacks with its radiant palm or two attacks with its shooting star.

action.name: Radiant Palm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Shooting Star
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Starfall {@recharge 5}
entries: The starcaller summons a brilliant orb of radiant energy at a point in the sky within 150-feet, then brings it crashing into the ground in a 20-foot radius area. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any creature that fail this save by 5 or more is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Step Through The Stars (3/Day)
entries: The starcaller vanishes in a brilliant flash of light and reappears with an equally bright flash in an unoccupied space within 200 ft. Each creature within 10-feet of where the starcaller began or ended must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. After teleporting, the starcaller may make a single attack with radiant palm or shooting star.

These celestial beings stand at roughly the height of an average human, have a similar build and form as a human, and even have a voice that sounds human in nature. . . but their true appearance is a mystery to all but the gods. The starcallers wear black robes that seem to have a galaxy swimming across them, as if they are a scrying device to a far off location in the universe. Their hoods are always up, their hands covered by gloves, and their feet firmly secured in a pair of boots, leaving no physical portion of the starcaller's body visible.

Looking into these robes, even at a distance of 5 feet away and even for creatures with {@sense darkvision}, is the same as looking into a void. There is clearly something beneath the robes to give it form - a mouth to speak words, hands to unleash spells and attacks, but even on the rare occasions when a starcaller is defeated when their hood is pulled back the robes immediately deflate and are left empty.

entries.name: Interplanar Travellers
entries: The starcallers answer to no one. They show up whenever the balance between the planes is threatened, handle the situation, and disappear. They show no allegiance to good or evil, simply to the balance; though typically they are fighting against the forces of evil. A starcaller can step through any number of planes with each step. It uses this ability to travel massive distances in moments even without the use of true teleportation.

entries.name: Celestial Heritage
entries: While mortals are uncertain of their origin or their appearance, it is clear that the starcallers are celestial in nature. They speak the language of the gods with profound elegance and beauty, unleash powerful divine magics, and are resistant to radiant attacks. Many theorize that these entities have been around since the beginning of time, an unbiased protector of the multiverse. No one who has encountered a starcaller first hand disagree with this idea.

monster.name: Mystic Spellblade
languages: Celestial and any three other languages

trait.name: Spiritual Alignment
entries: The spellblade is unarmed, but has two spectral weapons that follow her constantly, one a longsword and the other a flail. These weapons act according to the spellblade's will. On the spellblade's turn, she may give mental commands to these weapons to have them move up to 30 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spellblade uses her Spiritual Suppression if able. She then makes one attack with her spectral longsword and one attack with her spectral flail.

action.name: Spectral Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Spectral Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Spiritual Suppression {@recharge 5}
entries: The spellblade summons a set of ethereal bindings to subdue a target within 90 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Relentless Assault (1/Day)
entries: The spellblade summons 5 new spectral longswords at her side. One at a time she grabs hold of these blades. When the spellblade grabs a new longsword, she may teleport up to 120 feet into an unoccupied space and attack a creature within 5 feet. She makes a separate attack roll for each longsword attack. Hit or miss, after each attack the spectral weapon fades away. When all of the swords have been expended, she teleports back to her original location.

reaction.name: Spiritual Barrier
entries: The spellblade adds 3 to the result of any spell saving throw by boosting her fortitude with spiritual energy.

Mystic Spellblade Spellblades are divine warriors, a kind of paladin that answers to no king, noble, or order - only to the gods. These serene fighters are almost always women, as their combat style is quite elegant. They stand far from battle, dressed in beautiful garments, focusing only on guiding their weapons and dodging attacks. On rare occasions they will need to get their hands dirty with a devastating series of attacks from newly conjured ethereal weapons. It is even rarer that a target survive the onslaught.

Spellblades exist for both good and evil gods, following the will of their deity with every action performed, hoping to one day be accepted as worthy of ascension and given the full gifts of a celestial being. A spellblade following a good god often has weapons that glow blue, green, or white while followers of an evil god will have weapons that are blood red or black. Both kinds of spellblades are dangerous for anyone with differing views of the world.

entries.name: Judgement of the Gods
entries: The spellblade considers their word to be the same as those of the gods. If someone goes against the teachings of their god or against their god's declarations, the spellblade will have no hesitation to strike down the transgressor regardless of their status or alignment. Ironically, paladins of other gods are often the ones who find themselves fighting these spellblades, for both are stubborn and unrelenting in their beliefs. Neither is willing to cast aside their values and often the spellblade will be forced to make an example of these holy warriors.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The necromancer has the following wizard spells prepared:

entries: A simple lower level necromancer wizard. As is typical for a necromancer, they are often accompanied by skeletal warriors or sometimes even a golem. Necromancers can serve a variety of purposes and have too many backgrounds to specify a single set of details to them. Use them as needed.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, whenever the ninja attacks, it can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to one creature hit with an attack if it had advantage on the attack roll or if it has an ally within 5 feet of its target that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Rigorous Training
entries: The ninja can hold its breath for up to five minutes and cannot be {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Grappling Hook
entries: The ninja is skilled in the use of a grappling hook, allowing it to scale structures with ease. The ninja gains a 20 ft. climb speed.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Throwing Star
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: The ninja throws a smoke bomb at its feet. This creates a cloud of smoke in a 10-foot radius area  all creatures within this area will be {@condition blinded} and it heavily obscures the area to creatures outside of it. This cloud persists until the beginning of the ninja's next turn.

A master of stealth and discrete elimination, a ninja belongs to an ancient order of ninjutsu warriors. These combatants have extreme discipline, pushing their bodies to its limits to gain special talents such as holding their breath for extended periods of time, detecting an enemy's location even in a pitch black room, and immunity to everything but the most advanced poisons. They do not lean towards good or evil but simply follow the commands of the elders in their order.

entries.name: Dishonor in Detection
entries: For a ninja, to be unseen is to stay alive another night. They will sometimes remain unmoving for hours at a time, just waiting for the perfect opportunity to strike. They will learn patrol patterns, weaknesses in defenses, secrets that can be used to exploit - and all of this for a single slice of the blade and a swift escape. If they are caught in direct combat they will flee, using their grappling hook and smoke bombs to escape and fight another day... but they will hang their head in shame regardless.

trait.name: Poison Trail
entries: The savageclaw's body exudes poison in a 5 foot cube around it. Whenever the savageclaw moves, this poison follows along and fills every space the savageclaw touched during its movement. This poison dissipates after 1 round. Any creature that moves through one of these poison clouds must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. A creature that holds their breath while moving through one of these spaces has advantage on the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The savageclaw makes two attacks with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Poison Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Creatures poisoned in this way cannot use reactions. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Noxious Discharge (1/Day)
entries: The savageclaw lets out a powerful blast of poison gas in a 15 foot cube originating on itself. Any creature in this area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Stalking through deep caverns, the savageclaw secretes poisonous gases and liquids with every step it takes. It is a large, flightless insectile beast roughly the size of a wolf. It has glowing green eyes and incredibly powerful mandibles that it uses to crush through armored enemies. Large armored plates cover its body, making difficult for larger predators to harm them as they use their superior speed and poison to escape. The savageclaw's primary weapon is a long segmented tail similar to that of a scorpion that it uses to impale and poison victims.

entries.name: Pack Hunters
entries: A savageclaw rarely hunts alone. They typically move in packs of 4-8, but sometimes will send scouting groups of one or two up ahead of the rest. They can produce clouds of poison with specific scents that travel quickly through the caverns and alert the rest of their pack to dangers or potential meals. The savageclaws will quickly converge on that location, approaching with terrifying ferocity and ready to fight.

entries.name: Subterranean Dwellers
entries: The savageclaws live exclusively underground. They do not fear sunlight and are not weak when exposed to it, but feel at home when underground. Their hunting styles and predatory nature gives them an instinctual need to stay in the dark. The tunnels of deep caves also allows for them to set up entire pockets of odorless, poisonous gar to weaken their prey without them being aware of the imminent threat at hand.

monster.name: Obsidian Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spell and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapons are magical.

trait.name: Molten Core
entries: Whenever a creature with 5ft. deals 20 damage or more to the golem in a single round of combat, a spray of lava erupts, dealing 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage to the attacker.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem can use its Molten Surge if available. It then makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the golem can't use its slam on another target. The golem can have one target grappled with each fist.

action.name: Molten Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: Until the end of its next turn, the golem deals an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage with each of its slam attacks.

action.name: Smelt Intruders (1/Day)
entries: If the golem has a creature grappled in both of its fists it can use this ability to attempt to turn them to molten puddle. The golem is programmed to use this only for max efficiency so it will wait until it holds 2 targets to use it. Each grappled creature makes a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much as a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a puddle of molten flesh.

A powerful guardian made from volcanic glass and powered by lava, this azer-crafted construct serves as a deadly guardian. It stands at roughly nine feet tall with broad shoulders nearly four feet across. It has arms so large that they seem absurd, even for a creature of such a large stature. It uses these arms to pick up even human sized creatures in a single fist and then to crush them. It will even use these grappled targets as weapons against their own allies, a particularly brutal display for creatures that bleed or break easily.

As with other golems, it is effectively eternal in its lifespan and only obeys orders from its master. It obeys these commands without question. The azer will send these expendable soldiers to wreak havoc in a efreeti fortress, killing dozens or sometimes hundreds of their slaves before someone finally manages to destroy it. When not on offense, they guard the azer's armories and smelteries with their ever watching eyes.

entries.name: Mobile Smeltery
entries: The golem has tubes that run through its body, pumping the lava that is its lifeblood to all of its extremities. When it has a target grasped in both hands, they are almost completely obscured by its two massive obsidian fists. It will then open up pumps in the center each hand and unleash a powerful flow of lava, causing the helpless victim to be melted into a horrific puddle of molten rock and flesh.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ogre makes two attacks with its greatmaul or with its javelin.

action.name: Greatmaul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) blåslagningsskada.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Punt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, being thrown 20 ft. and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or pushed 10 ft. and not knocked {@condition prone} on a success.

action.name: War Drums {@recharge 5}
entries: The warchief play the drums of war. All other ogres within 120 ft. that can hear the drums may use their reaction to make a melee attack against an enemy in range.

This section expands upon the ogre creature found in other publications. For more information about ogre behaviors, intelligence, and their culture please consult these other sources. These following monsters give a few more options for these popular monstrous creature types, making them into a more diverse and exciting threat.

Ogre shamans use innate spellcasting to 'move earth, create pretty colors, and make ground clouds. Their skin has also become infused with magic, giving them additional defenses against enemy spellcasters. They also still hit absurdly hard. The warchief commands his fellow ogres by playing the drums of war. They are also masters of rockball and put those abilities to use by hurling enemies through the air (and off cliffs) with powerful kicks.

trait.name: Thick Hide
entries: The ogre has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting Note
entries: The ogre shaman's innate spells do not require material component.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ogre's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The ogre can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries: This section expands upon the ogre creature found in other publications. For more information about ogre behaviors, intelligence, and their culture please consult these other sources. These following monsters give a few more options for these popular monstrous creature types, making them into a more diverse and exciting threat.

Ogre shamans use innate spellcasting to 'move earth, create pretty colors, and make ground clouds. Their skin has also become infused with magic, giving them additional defenses against enemy spellcasters. They also still hit absurdly hard. The warchief commands his fellow ogres by playing the drums of war. They are also masters of rockball and put those abilities to use by hurling enemies through the air (and off cliffs) with powerful kicks.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the ore can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Demonblood Rage
entries: The orc is in a constant state of rage due to its demonic blood. It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons and deals 2 additional damage with each attack (included in the attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two attacks with its greataxe or its spear.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Furious Strikes (1/Day)
entries: The orc doubles its Demonblood Rage bonus damage to 4 this turn, then makes three attacks with its greataxe. Until the end of the orc's next turn, all attacks made against it have advantage.

The way the demonblood transformation affects an orc is unique to each creature. Berserkers are thrown into a constant state of rage. These were the orcs charged blindly into battle, seeing the only honorable death as one surrounded by a pile of corpses of their slaughtered enemies. They usually grow a full foot from the infusion and their muscles bulge with unnatural strength.

entries.name: Orcs
entries: This section expands upon the orc creature found in other publications. For more information about orc savagery, their fighting styles, and their gods please consult these other sources.

entries.name: Demonblood Orcs
entries: Demonblood orcs are those who have made a deal with a powerful demon lord in exchange for strength. This deal often involves serving in the demon lord's armies, capturing an ancient relic, or capturing creatures to be used as blood tributes. These orcs have their bodies covered in glowing tattooes - their color and style specific to the demon lord that granted them this blessing of power. Weaker orcs die from this process, while the strong become as powerful as ten ordinary orcs. Once their contact has been completed, these orcs retain this enhanced strength and will often use it to conquer and pillage with a ferocity that most town are not prepared to fight against until the demon lord calls upon them once again.

trait.name: Blood Magic
entries: Whenever the orc deals damage to an enemy with a spell, it gains 5 temporary hit points. Additionally, the orc can use its bonus action to pay {@dice 1d10} hit points to make the next spell it casts act as if it were cast at one spell slot higher.

trait.name: Uncontainable Power
entries: When the orc dies, it explodes violently. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is an 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following Sorcerer spells prepared:

entries: These orcs were already adept at spellcasting. Being infused with demon blood allows them to become even more powerful by sacrificing their own life force to enhance the strength of their spells while simultaneously absorbing the life force from their victims. The blood that fills them is volatile because of this cocktail of overlapping magic, causing these orcs to violently explode upon being killed.

entries.name: Orcs
entries: This section expands upon the orc creature found in other publications. For more information about orc savagery, their fighting styles, and their gods please consult these other sources.

entries.name: Demonblood Orcs
entries: Demonblood orcs are those who have made a deal with a powerful demon lord in exchange for strength. This deal often involves serving in the demon lord's armies, capturing an ancient relic, or capturing creatures to be used as blood tributes. These orcs have their bodies covered in glowing tattooes - their color and style specific to the demon lord that granted them this blessing of power. Weaker orcs die from this process, while the strong become as powerful as ten ordinary orcs. Once their contact has been completed, these orcs retain this enhanced strength and will often use it to conquer and pillage with a ferocity that most town are not prepared to fight against until the demon lord calls upon them once again.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Demon's Aim
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can choose to tap into its demonic blood to make its next shot. The orc's next ranged attack takes a -3 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, add +6 to the attack's damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two attacks with its longbow or with its shortswords.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Volley {@recharge 5}
entries: The orc makes a ranged attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of a point it can see within its weapon's range. It makes a separate attack roll for each target.

These orcs were archers before, but with this new blood they have uncanny aim. They stab themselves with each arrow before firing, causing them to inflict painful necrotic damage upon their targets. They can also tap into this well of power, pulling their bowstring back further than thought possible and letting loose an arrow that hits with the strength of two.

entries.name: Orcs
entries: This section expands upon the orc creature found in other publications. For more information about orc savagery, their fighting styles, and their gods please consult these other sources.

entries.name: Demonblood Orcs
entries: Demonblood orcs are those who have made a deal with a powerful demon lord in exchange for strength. This deal often involves serving in the demon lord's armies, capturing an ancient relic, or capturing creatures to be used as blood tributes. These orcs have their bodies covered in glowing tattooes - their color and style specific to the demon lord that granted them this blessing of power. Weaker orcs die from this process, while the strong become as powerful as ten ordinary orcs. Once their contact has been completed, these orcs retain this enhanced strength and will often use it to conquer and pillage with a ferocity that most town are not prepared to fight against until the demon lord calls upon them once again.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the ore can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Demon's Sight
entries: he orc has enhanced sight from its demonic blood. It has {@sense truesight} out to 30 ft.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two attacks with its longsword or its spear.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Precision Attacks {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, the orc taps into its demonic sight and finds its opponent's weak spots. Each weapon attack the orc makes against an enemy within 30 feet this turn is made with advantage.

reaction.name: Demonic Endurance
entries: The orc reduces the damage dealt by a single source to 10.

Demonblood warriors are the strongest melee fighters of them all. The berserkers have raw power, but the warriors have tactics and strategy along with their natural orcish fury. They use their demonic vision to exploit their opponent's weaknesses and can call on a powerful combination of orcish and demonic blood to cause powerful to attacks to glance off almost harmlessly.

entries.name: Orcs
entries: This section expands upon the orc creature found in other publications. For more information about orc savagery, their fighting styles, and their gods please consult these other sources.
Demonblood Orcs

Demonblood orcs are those who have made a deal with a powerful demon lord in exchange for strength. This deal often involves serving in the demon lord's armies, capturing an ancient relic, or capturing creatures to be used as blood tributes. These orcs have their bodies covered in glowing tattooes - their color and style specific to the demon lord that granted them this blessing of power. Weaker orcs die from this process, while the strong become as powerful as ten ordinary orcs. Once their contact has been completed, these orcs retain this enhanced strength and will often use it to conquer and pillage with a ferocity that most town are not prepared to fight against until the demon lord calls upon them once again.

monster.name: Overgrowth Ghoul
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Floral Fortification
entries: The ghoul can use its action to plant its body into the ground and become fortified or it can uproot and return to its mobile ghoul form. While fortified, the ghoul has its AC increased to 14, its movement speed is reduced to 0 ft., and as long as it has at least 1 hit point it regains {@dice 1d4} hit points at the beginning of its turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} för att träffa, når 1,5 meter, ett mål. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) snittskada.

action.name: Root Slash (Fortified Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

Sometimes when a corpse is reanimated, it is so infested with plantlife that the two form a symbiotic relationship as a means to better survive. Its appearance is similar to that of a zombie, as it is still a body that is being risen from the dead, but it has vines and leaves twisting around its body. Flowers sometimes sprout out of its eyes or grow in clusters out of its stomach. It is a twisted, morbid sight to combine such beauty with death and decay.

The ghoul can take root and and dig its vines deep into the ground, allowing it to pull energy from the soil but also causing it to become immobilized. While in this form it can also make long range attacks by erupting roots and vines from the ground and lashing at their foes. While not rooted, it acts as a traditional undead, shambling about and doing whatever is demanded of it from its master.

entries.name: Unnatural Manifestations
entries: The plant symbiosis can be forced upon the arisen rather than naturally occurring. If a wood wraith claims a life, plants will swarm around it and take hold. When the corpse reanimates in this scenario it is because the plants are controlling its movements and not because it has been given life again. These ghouls are under the wood wraith's control, doing what is demanded of them without question as all good servants should.

trait.name: Attraction to Fire
entries: Pyreflies can detect any nearby fires and will flock to them, dancing and making beautiful colors. They grow aggressive when these fires are put out.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The pyrefly sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light an additional 5 feet.

action.name: Spark
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) fire damage.

action.name: Flare
entries: The pyrefly gives off a brilliant flash of light. All non-pyrefly creatures within 10 feet of the pyrefly must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ignite (1/Day)
entries: The pyrefly sets fire to a flammable object not being worn or carried.

A pyrefly is a tiny elemental quite similar to a firefly in nature, but the pyrefly is quite a bit more deadly. They obsess over open flames and when they find a source of it they swarm and signal to other pyreflies to gather round with a brilliant display of lights. They will cause the fire to dance with beautiful colors, creating plumes of colored light and flashes of dazzling flame. This display of color is also their way of finding a suitable mate.

entries.name: Separation Anxiety
entries: Once a pyrefly has found a source of flame, it will go berserk if anything threatens to put it out. Ordinarily a pyrefly is friendly and beautiful, but make a move to extinguish their fire, especially during a mating display, and they will go all out with tiny flare attacks. They will set anything and everything around them ablaze and give off warning flares so bright that it can blind creatures temporarily.

entries.name: Omen of Luck
entries: While a will-o-wisp is considered to be bad luck, a pyrefly is considered a sign of good things to come in most cultures. Their mating rituals typically coincide with patterns of beautiful weather and clear, starry night skies, so people come to think the pyreflies bring these conditions. In reality, the pyreflies can glimpse weather in the near future and know when they will have plenty of time to stay with a blazing fire, so they are in fact an indicator of lovely weather.

trait.name: Radiant Aura
entries: The stalker sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

trait.name: Charging Strike
entries: If the stalker moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target it begins to glow with divine energy. If the stalker that target with its impale attack on this turn, the target takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage and becomes charged with divine energies. The first time that target deals damage to the stalker on its next turn, it takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage as these energies surge.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stalker makes two attacks with its impale or three with its radiant beam.

action.name: Impale
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Resplendent Assault {@recharge 5}
entries: he stalker unleashes twin beams of energy that spiral around the room. Each creature within 60 feet of the stalker make two {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage for each failed save.

The stalker is of a strange design, with three spider-like legs that are each roughly ten feet long. Each leg has four joints, allowing for superior navigation in any terrain. These legs are attached to an oval-shaped body with a twin cannon mounted beneath. Along the edge of this central body are numerous glowing orbs of light that become supercharged as the stalker approaches an opponent. The cannons on its body can fire blasts of radiant energy at long range or have them rotate around its body rapidly bisect a room with damaging light.

entries.name: Tomb Guardians
entries: After an unfortunate incident involving a necromancer, a small town landed themselves with the problem of all of their dead slowly coming back to life and shambling back towards their homes. They sent men on shifts to defend their graveyards, but sometimes it would be a week between incidents and other times there would be four or five in a single day. After a few deaths, they decided to give technology a try and so they hired a gnomish inventor of great renown who decided to create the ultimate defender against the undead - The Radiant Stalker.

entries.name: A Zombie's Worst Nightmare
entries: The stalker has no flesh to be eaten and each of its legs can easily step through the undead, impaling and usually killing them in a single move. The core components of the stalker are kept high off the ground and away from their reach. Even if zombies do manage to surround it, it can always use its Resplendent Assault to turn them all to ash in an instant.

entries.name: Also a Crypt Robber's Worst Nightmare
entries: While these machines were mainly intended to keep the undead at bay, they also serve the very useful purpose of "deterring" crypt robbers. The stalker will let anyone into the tomb to visit, but if it detects that creature has left with more than it came, it will stop their passage. If the creature attacks the stalker or refuses to put back what was taken, they are met with a swift death with the last thing they see being a bright flash of light.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The raven doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The raven has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Lightning Charged
entries: When the raven hits with a melee attack, it deals an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The raven makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons. It then summons a lightning orb.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage.

action.name: Summon Lightning Orb
entries: The raven creates a 3 inch diameter sphere of electricity in an unoccupied space within 60 feet. This sphere persists for 1 minute or until the raven is killed. A creature that ends its turn in the same space as a lightning orb takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage. On initiative count 20, the orbs spark a 5-foot wide line of lighting between all other orbs within 20 feet. Creatures caught within one of these streaks of lightning must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage.

This raven may be small but it certainly should not be underestimated. The storm raven is a lightning imbued bird that has the ability to summon orbs of lightning to destroy its foes. At a glance it appears to be an ordinary raven, but when it flaps its wings small bolts of lightning arc to nearby objects. As it approaches a surface for landing, lightning will spark from its talons to the surface. Even with these capabilities, they behave similarly to an ordinary raven unless they need to defend themselves.

entries.name: Sorcerer's Spark
entries: Similar to a sorcerer, these raven's have their abilities awoken at a critical moment in their lives. This is almost always as the raven is about to be killed be a predator. Some innate power stored deep in the creature, extending back for thousands of years, is unleashed and the raven can they harness the power of the storm. Immediately, the raven grows more intelligent as their mind is opened to the world and they gain a complete understanding of their capabilities.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or the scarab burrows under the skin of the target. A creature may use its action to attempt to cut out the scarab. That creature makes a {@dc 10} sleight of hand check, killing the scarab and cutting it out of the victim on a success. Success or fail, the creature in which the scarab is burrowed takes 1 point of piercing damage from this maneuver.\nIf the scarab is burrowed, at the end of each of its turns it moves closer to the creature's brain, dealing an additional 1 piercing damage. If the scarab is not removed, after 3 turns of being burrowed it latches on to the brain of the creature and takes control of its body until removed. A creature that has a scarab removed from its brain falls {@condition unconscious} for {@dice 1d4} days.

A tiny creature with terrifying capabilities. These beetle-like creatures were bred and raised to be the ultimate guardians within a sacred temple. They do not disturb any ancient relics or the bodies of the dead, live for over a hundred years, and require little to no sustenance to survive. They are small enough to squeeze through the cracks and hidden passageways in the stone halls they call home, waiting for living intruders to make their way into the temple so they can have a true meal.

entries.name: Controllers of Mind
entries: The scarab enjoys nothing more than to gain control of a living creature. It will bite them and burrow beneath the flesh, crawling along under their skin until it reaches the location where spine and brain meet. It then clamps down on this cluster of nerves and gains control of that creature's actions. The victim's mind silently screams out in agony as the scarab feeds on their cranial fluid. The scarab defends its meal by directing the creature to attack its own allies or sometimes to simply flee to a location so it can eat in peace.

trait.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The terror beast makes itself appear as creatures far more frightening than itself. Whenever a creature attacks the terror beast, roll a {@dice d20}. On a result of 11 or higher, the attack hits part of its illusory appearance and does no damage. Each time the terror beast is successfully hit, it changes form to a new horror. Creatures with {@sense blindsight} or {@sense truesight} can see the terror beast's true form and are not affected by this feature. Whenever the terror beast dies, it reverts to its actual form as a small, seemingly non-threatening creature.

trait.name: Unnatural Insight
entries: The terror beast learns a creature's deepest fears simply by looking at them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The terror beast makes two attacks: one with Terror Assault and one with Tear Asunder.

action.name: Terror Assault
entries: Target creature within 90 feet must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage on a failed save and become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and not frightened on a successful one.

action.name: Tear Asunder
entries: Target creature within 90 feet must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage and becoming convinced one of their limbs have been violently ripped from their body on a failed save, or half as much damage and their limb remains intact on a successful one. If they fail the save by 10 or more, they become convinced their eyes are torn out. Even though the effects aren't real, the victim is convinced it is reality and suffer from the same detriments as if they actually lost that body part. This deception ends when the terror beast dies.

action.name: Worst Nightmares {@recharge 5}
entries: The terror beast unleashes a torrent of nightmarish illusions against its enemies. Each creature within 30 feet of the terror beast must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and not paralyzed on a successful one. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points from this attack, the terror beast.

action.name: Face Death (1/Day)
entries: The terror beast infests the mind of a creature within 90 feet with nightmare and forces it to live out its own death over and over, each death more gruesome than the last. Have that player make death saving throws until they reach 3 successes, 3 failures, or rolls a natural 20. If they reached 3 failures, the creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on all attacks, saving throws, and ability checks for the next {@dice 1d4} turns. On 3 successes, the creature takes half as much psychic damage and does not have disadvantage. If the player rolls a natural 20 on one of their saves, the effect ends immediately with no damage dealt as their mind conquers this attack.

While this entity is called a terror beast, its physical appearance is similar to that of a large rabbit. It has comically large, floppy ears, big green eyes, and is covered in light brown fur. Unlike a rabbit, it does have a set of claws and some sharp teeth, but it is small enough that it can only take small nibbles of flesh with a bite. Even though this is the true form of the terror beast, very few will ever get a chance to see it.

entries.name: Aspiring for Intimidation
entries: The terror beast longs to inflict fear in other creatures, but unfortunately its ordinary form doesn't help the cause. To compensate for this fact, the terror beast is capable of creating incredibly realistic illusions. It also has unnatural insight into the minds of others, uncovering their deepest horrors with a single glance and transforming into them. This often is what causes its opponent's to cower in fear and brings tremendous joy to the terror beast.

The beast is constantly on the move, looking for new victims it can literally scare to death. They will often wander into moderately sized town and lurk in back alleyways, waiting for unsuspecting victims to approach at night. Sometime the terror beast will let these people flee and spread the word that there is some sort of nightmarish creature plaguing their city. The terror beast relishes in whatever decision the town makes - either send these people away as insane or turn to panic against this unknown monster.

entries.name: Psychic Assault
entries: The terror beast uses a powerful set of psychic abilities to attack its opponents rather than its tiny claws and teeth. It can make a victim think that they are being ripped limb from limb, unable to recognize that their body is still in tact and responding to the pain as if it were real. The beast can even cause a creature to live out its own death, unleashing all of their fears one after another and causing them to die from each of them until their mind collapses under the mental strain.

monster.name: The Emerald Queen

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The queen makes two attacks: one with her shortsword and one with her thorn whip, or two attacks with her longbow.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Thorn Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) if the Queen is not already grappling a creature. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. If the queen uses this attack while a target is already {@condition grappled}, she may pull the target to her and deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d4 +4}) piercing damage automatically.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Hail of Thorns {@recharge 5}
entries: The queen launches a volley of deadly thorns in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: The queen can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The queen regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The queen makes an attack with her shortsword or her longbow.

legendary.name: Swift Repositioning
entries: The queen can move up to half of her movement speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|attacks of opportunity}.

Deep in the forest, so far from society that it begins to blend with the realm of the fey, is the Domain of the Emerald Queen. For thousands of years this throne belonged to an Emerald King by the name of Sylarrian - a kind and seemingly eternal ruler who managed the balance between the two planes. Then an elf named Lylia found her way into Sylarrian's kingdom and the two fell in love. As time went on, she began to crave his power. . . lusted for it. The elder fey that give power to the crown decided it time for new leadership if Sylarrian was blind the plot unraveling under his own nose, within his own domain.

She killed Sylarrian with a dagger as he embraced her tenderly, then took the crown and named herself the Emerald Queen,. This title is quite formal for a woman who is more a fighter than an aristocrat. She decided mortals unworthy to pass through her domain and blocked it off with a massive ring of thorns and vines, leaving only one passage into her realm. This passage is guarded by both plant and beast alike. Here she rules with her powerful magic and remarkable skill with a bow, making sure not to expose herself to the same weakness as her former lover.

Lylia is a beautiful elf with pale skin and midnight black hair that wraps around and hangs down over her chest in a braid. Her eyes are a stunning and fierce green, ablaze with confidence and wisdom. She wears incredibly well-crafted green-tinted leather armor, not something expected of a queen but rather a warrior. Hanging from one hip is a silver sword with a gleam of emerald along the edge of the blade and hanging off of the other side is a curled up strand of thorns. The final item is the crown thorns and plant life that wraps around her head, the Crown of the Emerald Queen. It seems painful to wear and her face even appears to be permanently scarred from some of the thorns, but she doesn't pay it any mind.

entries.name: Bound to the Ancient Ways
entries: The power of the crown comes with drawbacks of its own. If anyone wishes to challenge her for the crown, she must leave them unharmed as they go through the Emerald Trials. If they are successful in these trials, she will engage them in combat in her throne room and if defeated must give up her power and leave the realm in shame (if they choose to let her live at all).
You can send your players through the Domain of the Emerald Queen by referring to the Dungeon section of the {@footnote Toolkit|Not yet converted for 5eTools.}.

monster.name: Timeless Chronomancer

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Djävulen har fördel på räddningskast mot trollformler och andra magiska effekter.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting Note
entries: The devil's innate spells do not require any components.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chronomancer uses its Domes of Distortion ability if able. It then makes one attack with each of its daggers.

action.name: Dagger of Ages
entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or immediately age {@dice 1d20} years and take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) force damage. A creature within a Dome of Vigor has disadvantage on this saving throw. A greater restoration spell can restore a creature's age to normal.

action.name: Dagger of Sands
entries: {@atk mw} +10 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw against being magically petrified. A creature within a Dome of Lethargy has disadvantage on this saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is also {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified}. Only a greater restoration or wish spell can restore the creature to normal.

action.name: Domes of Distortion {@recharge 5}
entries: The chronomancer creates two 15-foot radius domes at two locations within 120 feet. These domes last for one next minute or until the chronomancer uses this ability again. One dome, the Dome of Vigor, gives the creatures within the benefits of the Haste spell while the other, the Dome of Lethargy, gives the detriments of the Slow spell. The Dome of Haste is a green in color while the Dome of Lethargy is blue in color. These domes cannot overlap.

action.name: Entombed By Time
entries: The chronomancer conjures an hourglass shaped prison in an attempt to trap a creature within 120 feet. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be imprisoned. Sand immediately begins to pour from the top of the hourglass to the bottom, causing the trapped creature to age rapidly. A creature that starts its turn within the hourglass ages {@dice 1d20} years. If 30 points of damage are dealt to the glass walls of the hourglass in a single turn, the glass shatters and the hourglass disappears.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chronomancer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.

legendaryHeader: The chronomancer can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The chronomancer regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Dagger
entries: The chronomancer makes an attack with one of its daggers.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The chronomancer magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Entomb (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The chronomancer uses its Entombed By Time ability.

The chronomancer long ago stopped feeling the effects of the passage of time. He primarily stays within a castle his family constructed thousands of years ago. It rests on peninsula that extends out into the ocean and creates a stunning view. It also makes the castle nearly impossible to siege. From here he has watched the waves erode away the stone and reshape the land into something completely different than what it was when he was a child oh so long ago. Once in an ordinary man's lifetime he will leave and take a few years to explore the world, take note of how it has changed, and collect enough books to last him another 50 or 60 years until he feels the urge to go out and explore once again.

Despite being thousands of years old, the chronomancer appears to be in his mid-forties, this was his age he was when he unlocked the secrets of time magic. He spent every moment of his adolescence and adult life in study and performing experiments. He had a passion and his parents had incredible wealth. They were proud to be raising a scholar and a spellcaster that would shape the future of the world.

His motivations changed when his mother became sick with a disease that no cleric could seem to cure. He put her in a stasis to keep her alive until he could find a way to fix her. Afterwards, he gathered the best healers from around the world and brought them back to the castle, but when he broke the spell he realized the terrible mistake he had made. In her stasis she could feel the pain of the disease the entire time. . . he had trapped her in an inescapable prison of agony for years and her sane mind had long since faded. He would never seem to forgive himself for this and decided that he would increase his own life and continue to live on with this guilt until he has finally made peace with himself. Thousands of years later and this still has not happened.

entries.name: Decider of Fate
entries: The chronomancer has turned the tide in a few wars when he saw it fit for one side to be victorious over the other, stopping time for all but himself and with a single strike of his magical dagger putting an end to a king or general. Stories of the chronomancer and his influence are older than even the most ancient of history books. His exploits are sung about in taverns, told around campfires, and recited at dinner parties. He has written down everything he has done in his life and sometimes the events were so long ago that he gets to rediscover the memories as he reads them in his own books.

entries.name: Hoarder of Knowledge
entries: The chronomancer knows just about all there is to be known in this world, but does not spread it on his journeys. He is there merely to observe and to retain. He has forgotten more than even most elves will learn in an entire lifetime. When someone wishes to obtain knowledge of time magic from the chronomancer, he will demand they prove themselves worthy of wielding such power and engage them in combat - even if it is one against many. Few have managed to pass this test, but he will not spare them death in this combat, knowing that if they are not able to defeat him then they would not have the wisdom to use this magic and would fall victim to the same mistakes he made so many years ago.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting Note
entries: The witch doctor's innate spells require no material components.

trait.name: Totemic Ritualist
entries: Whenever the witch doctor uses its action to cast a spell, it may use its bonus action to conjure a totem if able.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witch doctor conjures a totem is able. It then makes two attacks with its claws or two with its blowgun.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Conjure Totem {@recharge 4}
entries:
The Witch Doctor creates a powerful, magical totem in an unoccupied space within 30 feet. This totem is a tiny object with 15 hit points and AC 12. The totem provides bonuses to the witch doctor and its allies until destroyed. The witch doctor may only have one totem of each type active at a time. When the witch doctor summons a totem it chooses from the following options:
  Invigorating Totem - On initiative count 20 (losing ties), evil creatures within 30 feet of the totem regain 5 ({@damage 1d10}) hit points.
  Empowering Totem - Evil creatures within 30 feet of the totem deal an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage on all weapon attacks.
  Impeding Totem - The area within 30 feet of the totem is considered difficult terrain for non-evil creatures.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The witch doctor's innate spellcasting ability is ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). The witch doctor can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries: Calling to the spirits of the dead and dark inner magics for their power, the witch doctor is unique and frightening opponent. They adorn themselves with decorated masks, paint their skin with intricate patterns, wear the claws and teeth of animals about their necks, and carry pouches upon pouches of strange ingredients for their rituals. A witch doctor seems primitive at a glance, but have a greater understanding of spirits and death than all but the most knowledgeable scholars. They are obsessed with death and what follows, dedicating their entire lives to better understand it.

entries.name: Totemic Conjurers
entries: The witch doctor can reach into the ethereal plane, grab hold of an unsuspecting spirit, and pull it back to the material plane in the form of a physical entity they call a totem. The witch doctor is so well trained in this process that it takes them only a moment to complete the task. These manifestations are unique to the spirit bound and can either give strength to allies or harm their enemies. The spirits the witch doctor uses to complete this ritual do not come willingly and if the totem is destroyed they are destroyed along with it.

entries.name: Forbidden Ritualists
entries: The witch doctor does not show restraint when it comes to their rituals. They will pull over demonic servants, cause plagues to befall local villages, and can even cause the skies to rain blood if they are particularly skilled. Each victim they kill has something to offer in a ritual - hair, clothing, blood, teeth - it all appeases their gods in new and exciting way and can cause unforeseen results. It is not uncommon for the witch doctor to call over a force they cannot control, twisted abominations of realms buried so far down that no one can access them willingly. When this occurs, the witch doctor will throw themselves into servitude of this new force in hope of achieving greatness and power.

trait.name: Locus of Spirits
entries: Whenever a non-evil humanoid dies within 60 feet of the wraith, their body rises as an Overgrowth Ghoul under the wraith's control {@dice 1d4} rounds later.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith uses its Convert Flesh ability. It then makes two vine slash attacks.

action.name: Vine Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Convert Flesh
entries: Target creature within 60 feet makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against being magically petrified. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to wood and their movement speed is reduced to 0 ft. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature turns to wood and is {@condition petrified} for 24 hours.

action.name: Rain of Splinters {@recharge 5}
entries: The wraith unleashes an explosion of sharp splinters in a 15 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

Sometimes in order to deal with an evil spirit, it will be trapped inside of an object to serve as a prison. When the object chosen as the target of this imprisonment is a tree, a particularly powerful spirit can exert influence upon it. Over time the tree will decay, rot, and mold into a new form. It slowly changes to appear more and more humanoid in nature until finally the spirit has worn the plant down enough that it can take control and a woodwraith is formed. While the spirit is still trapped, it can channel its corruption through the tree and even raise the dead as overgrowth ghouls.

entries.name: Viciously Spiteful
entries: The wrath's first target will always be the ones who trapped them in the first place. It often takes years for the spirit to be able to animate their prison and during that time they are left to fester with hate and thoughts of revenge. There is a lingering magic within the spirit that guides it to its jailor, and while it is not a perfect guidance system, they will always find their way there eventually typically rallying an army of ghoul followers along the way.

entries.name: Return in Kind
entries: While imprisoned, there is another unintentional negative outcome - the spirit learns how to turn others to wood and trap them in prisons of their own. It does not have the power to cause this permanently, but it finds great joy seeing the ones that trapped it suffer a similar fate. The wraith will imprison their target of its hate and see to it that they suffer by taking their petrified form along as a witness as it converts their friends and family to ghouls under its control.

monster.name: Decaying Zoblin
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zoblin to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 10 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zoblin drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Putrid
entries: A creature that touches the zoblin or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1 necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage.

Zoblins are simply zombified goblins. These shambling entities can be a menace when a necromancer operates over the site of an old goblin village or battleground. The zoblins are comparable in strength to ordinary zombies but some with some unique abilities. Decaying zoblins are actively falling apart and will cause disease, an ordinary zoblin will latch on to targets and continue gnawing until their victim is dead, and a zoblin boss is strong enough to retain some of its fighting prowess. The most fearsome encounter one can have with these small undead creatures is in the form of the horde of zoblins which run down their enemies and tear them to pieces with their sheer numbers.

monster.name: Horde of Zoblins
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Swarm Fortitude
entries: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small goblin. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Plagued
entries: When the swarm hits with an attack, it deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horde uses its pull under ability if able, then uses its gnaw and claw attack.

action.name: Gnaw and Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Pull Under
entries: The horde attempts to envelope a creature within its space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) as they are pinned to the ground under a sea of zombies. This ability can only be used if the horde is above half of its maximum hit points.

Zoblins are simply zombified goblins. These shambling entities can be a menace when a necromancer operates over the site of an old goblin village or battleground. The zoblins are comparable in strength to ordinary zombies but some with some unique abilities. Decaying zoblins are actively falling apart and will cause disease, an ordinary zoblin will latch on to targets and continue gnawing until their victim is dead, and a zoblin boss is strong enough to retain some of its fighting prowess. The most fearsome encounter one can have with these small undead creatures is in the form of the horde of zoblins which run down their enemies and tear them to pieces with their sheer numbers.

monster.name: Zoblin
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zoblin to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zoblin drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Vicious Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and the zoblin attaches to the target. While attached, the zoblin doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the zoblin's turns, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. While the zoblin is attached, that creature's movement speed is also reduced by 10 ft. A creature may use its action to make a {@dc 11} {@skill Athletics} check, prying the zoblin loose on a success.

Zoblins are simply zombified goblins. These shambling entities can be a menace when a necromancer operates over the site of an old goblin village or battleground. The zoblins are comparable in strength to ordinary zombies but some with some unique abilities. Decaying zoblins are actively falling apart and will cause disease, an ordinary zoblin will latch on to targets and continue gnawing until their victim is dead, and a zoblin boss is strong enough to retain some of its fighting prowess.
